Package game

Class PlayerInventory

java.lang.Object
game.PlayerInventory
public class PlayerInventory extends Object
The PlayerInventory class represents a player's inventory in a game. It manages the collection of items a player has picked up, including chips and other items.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PlayerInventory()
    Constructs a PlayerInventory with an initial chip count of 0.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerInventory

      public PlayerInventory()
      Constructs a PlayerInventory with an initial chip count of 0.

  • Method Details

    • useItem

      public void useItem()
      Uses an item from the inventory. This method can be expanded to include logic for using specific types of items.

    • pickupItem

      public void pickupItem(item.Item item)
      Picks up an item and adds it to the inventory. If the item is a chip, increments the chip count instead of adding to the inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be picked up.

    • putDown

      public String putDown(item.Item item)
      Simulates putting down an item from the inventory. Returns the modified key of the item when it's put down.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be put down.
      Returns:
      The modified key of the item.

    • pickUp

      public void pickUp(item.Item item)
      Adds an item to the inventory. If the item is a chip, increments the chip count.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be added to the inventory.

    • getInventory

      public ArrayList<item.Item> getInventory()
      Retrieves the list of items in the player's inventory.
      Returns:
      The list of items in the inventory.

    • setInventory

      public void setInventory(ArrayList<item.Item> inventory)
      Sets the list of items in the player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      inventory - The new list of items to be set as the inventory.

    • getChipCount

      public int getChipCount()
      Gets the count of chips in the inventory.
      Returns:
      The number of chips collected.

    • setChipCount

      public void setChipCount(int chipCount)
      Sets the count of chips in the inventory.
      Parameters:
      chipCount - The new chip count.
